articles.title: DPRK Holidays to Be Observed in Nigeria
articles.content:
DPRK Holidays to Be Observed in Nigeria 
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of Nigeria for commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16 was formed with due ceremony in Abuja on Jan. 25.
 The inaugural ceremony elected the deputy president of the Senate of the Nigerian National Assembly chairman of the preparatory committee, and the national secretary of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria and the chairman of the Information Committee of the Senate vice-chairmen of the preparatory committee.    
 The preparatory committee set the commemoration period from Jan. 25 to Apr. 20 and discussed the issues of widely introducing the wise leadership and undying exploits of President  Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il through mass media, organizing colorful functions including a seminar, a film show and a photo exhibition and intensifying the movement for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people.

Bulletin Issued in Democratic Congo to Celebrate February 16
articles.content:
Bulletin Issued in Democratic Congo to Celebrate February 16 
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association released a bulletin on Jan. 21 in celebration of February 16, birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
 It carried an article introducing Kimjongilia under the title "Kimjongilia in full bloom on our planet."    
 In its preface the bulletin warmly congratulated the Korean people on the February holiday. It is an expression of unbounded reverence of the world people for Kim Jong Il that Kimjongilia is in full bloom on our planet, making it look red and adding luster to its name amid the keen interest of all people, it said.

articles.title: Greetings to Emir of Kuwait
articles.content:
Greetings to Emir of Kuwait 
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Sheikh Sabah Al-Ahmed Al-Jaber Al-Sabah on the occasion of his accession to the Emir of State of Kuwait.
 The message sincerely wished him great success in the responsible work for the country's development and prosperity and good health and happiness.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Toeing U.S. Line
South Headquarters of Pomchonghakryon Vows to Push Reunification Movement
articles.content:
South Headquarters of Pomchonghakryon Vows to Push Reunification Movement 
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- A meeting of activists for reunification of the South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification (Pomchonghakryon) was reportedly held at Sungsil University in Seoul on Jan. 21 and 22 to push the reunification movement.
 A ceremony of launching the south headquarters' actions for the new year took place at the meeting.    
 Speakers at the ceremony said that if the U.S. and pro-American conservatives are allowed to stem the trend of the times towards independent reunification, it will be impossible to achieve the peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula and a dark era will return to south Korea.
 They declared that youth and students would surely develop all the struggles into anti-U.S. actions under the uplifted slogan "Let us live in the spirit of by our nation itself free from U.S. forces!" and undertake a general offensive to force the U.S. forces to quit south Korea and thus bring about fresh victory in the anti-U.S. struggle.    
 They called upon the youth and students to make a higher leap full of great ambition and confidence and become heroes of the June 15 era.
 A declaration on their struggle titled "Let the youth and students at home and abroad take the lead in the dynamic three-point patriotic movement under the banner of 'By our nation itself'" was read out at the ceremony.

Greetings to Sri Lankan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Sri Lankan President
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Friday sent a message of greetings to Mahinda Rajapakse, president of Sri Lanka, on the occasion of the 58th anniversary of its independence.
 The message expressed belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between two countries would grow stronger and sincerely wished the president and people of Sri Lanka great success in their work for the country's stability and prosperity.

articles.title: Congratulations to Congolese President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Congolese President
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Congolese President Denis Sassou Nguesso upon his election as president of the African Union at its 6th Summit.
 We are pleased to note that the summit made great progress in solving the regional issues including disputes by its concerted efforts, further hastening the political and economic integration of the continent and developing the education and culture of Africa on a new stage, the message said.
 Expressing the belief that the union would make a great contribution to achieving the integration and unity, peace and prosperity of Africa thanks to the positive efforts and role of its president, the message wholeheartedly wished him success in his responsible work for the strengthening and development of the union.

articles.title: Greetings to Prime Minister of Sri Lanka
articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of Sri Lanka
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Ratnasiri Wickremanayake, prime minister of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka, on the occasion of the 58th anniversary of the independence of the country.
 The message sincerely wished the Sri Lankan prime minister great success in his responsible work for the stability and prosperity of the country and expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the days ahead.
 Meanwhile, Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to his Sri Lankan counterpart Mangala Samraweear.

articles.title: Congratulations to Mongolian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Mongolian Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Nyamaagiin Enkhbold upon his appointment as foreign minister of Mongolia.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations now favorably developing between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, the message sincerely wished the foreign minister great success in his new job.
